course.title: Automate the Boring Stuff with Python Programming
course.subtitle: A practical programming course for office workers, academics, and administrators who want to improve their productivity.

reviews.body:
The course is great, thank you very much, but it would be nice if you could update some of the lessons and look forward to new courses.

I recommend this course to everyone.

Amazing course. I learned a ton of fun and new things. I am surprised by the amount of utility that this course offers. I feel that I can make my life a lot better just by using the things taught in this course. I can not stress this enough how useful and fun this stuff is. I am a cs student so I have a programming background, but doing this course made me feel like a better programmer overall. Thanks a lot Al.

Great intro the world of coding without being to overwhelming. Some easy parts some rather complex parts.

All and all most of the subjects such as mailing, scraping, document and PDF handling is most likely being used in every office so this tutorial can be applied for many office fields :)

I found this course was a great way to get my "feet wet" in Ptyhon and is a great resource along with the book "Automate the Boring Stuff with Python". Al is a very good teacher. He was easy to follow and understand. Speech was clear. Audio was well done/ All around very pleased.

I really enjoyed the course and its content, Al Sweigart shows us it's not complicated to learn a new programming language and why Python is one of the best To-Go Languages to begin with. The content is quite complete for all the basics to the almost advance. There's a world ahead, but this may help a lot to aid our learning curve. As soon as I land a job, I'll invest on his reading materials as a token of my gratitude.
There should be a tool on udemy to try out the code... good overall but sometimes a bit complicated in explanation
good explanation, and good value in this training for annyone who want to start

Good beginner's python tutorial, and the instructor seems pleasant. With that said, I have found good tutorials for free on other platforms. I don't feel this tutorial helped me automate much stuff, and I end up thinking why and how would I need the code in my workflow. The information is really basic that I find myself getting a little impatient to find any useful parts, but then I have found there is no use for it in my workflow other than may be editing PDFs with python.

Probable one of the best course for the beginners to Python and overall programming as well. While the content is not exhaustive, it covers most fundamental concepts of python programming and also helps building the basic automation actions for day-to-day productivity task. The topics with GUI automation definitely takes you to a little more advance level. Overall a very good course on Python to begin with. Kudos to the tutor and his humorous anecdotes (... at some places). All thumbs up!

The course was very interesting and touches different areas of Python. If you are getting into Python, this is a good course to start with. Some pieces seems to be outdated (Amazon en checking e-mails). But the teacher is very well-spoken and clearly has a passion for Python.
Great for getting started with Python, suggested to all my friends whether they're trying to get into coding in general or coming from another language.

The course delivers as promised and touches enough subjects to give a beginner an idea to take python up to next level or not. I repeated this course twice to get a good understanding of the subject and have decided to take this knowledge further :)

instructor.name: Al Sweigart
instructor.briefIntroduction: Al Sweigart is a software developer in San Francisco. He has written four Python programming books, spoken at Python conferences, and has taught both kids and adults how to program. Python is his favorite programming language, and he is the developer of several open source modules for it. He is driven to make programming knowledge available to all, and his books freely available under a Creative Commons license.
